doc.title: No Whistles, Bells, or Bedlam
doc.plot: Radio legend, Jean Shepherd, in his inimitable Norman Rockwell's Americana style, narrates a James Halpin script about a man who anxiously awaits the birth of his son with many dreams of anticipation. When his son is finally born, he is deaf. The story reveals not only how the man helps his child overcome his challenges but to create an exemplary life experience in spite of it.
